item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 17, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Make your QEMU 10 times faster with this one weird trick (14 points | discuss)
2. New LLM optimization technique slashes memory costs up to 75% (191 points | 63 comments)
3. Settlement from Meta for Australian Users Impacted by Cambridge Analytica (48 points | 13 comments)
4. Running NetBSD on IBM ThinkPad 380Z (8 points | discuss)
5. Xiaomi Home Integration for Home Assistant (443 points | 243 comments)
6. Go Protobuf: The New Opaque API (207 points | 78 comments)
7. Making a watch from scratch (199 points | 36 comments)
8. Lfgss shutting down 16th March 2025 (day before Online Safety Act is enforced) (455 points | 265 comments)
9. Veo 2: Our video generation model (373 points | 174 comments)
10. Why is it so hard to buy things that work well? (2022) (543 points | 456 comments)
11. In Search of a Faster SQLite (232 points | 102 comments)
12. 'They must be somewhere': appeal for British oak to recreate Sutton Hoo ship (16 points | 8 comments)
13. What did Ada Lovelace's program actually do? (2018) (229 points | 78 comments)
14. Ruby Video – On a mission to index all Ruby conferences (174 points | 26 comments)
15. Advent of Code on the Nintendo DS (64 points | 18 comments)
16. Ask HN: SWEs how do you future-proof your career in light of LLMs? (289 points | 584 comments)
17. Waymo will bring autonomous vehicles to Tokyo (124 points | 38 comments)
18. Two Shanghais (9 points | 1 comment)
19. The Red Beads Experiment (21 points | 6 comments)
20. Forgotten Collection of Charles de Gaulle's Manuscripts Discovered in a Safe (42 points | 2 comments)
21. Modelica (228 points | 71 comments)
22. MIT study explains why laws are written in an incomprehensible style (6 points | discuss)
23. A new twist: The molecular machines that loop chromosomes also twist DNA (18 points | 4 comments)
24. Popeye and Tintin enter the public domain in 2025 along with Faulkner, Hemingway (265 points | 84 comments)
25. Using Guile for Emacs (128 points | 42 comments)
26. Quick takes on the recent OpenAI public incident write-up (65 points | 18 comments)
27. Mirror bacteria research poses significant risks, scientists warn (158 points | 126 comments)
28. U2's Larry Mullen Jr: my dyscalculia makes 'counting like climbing Everest' (43 points | 32 comments)
29. Our muscles will atrophy as we climb the Kardashev Scale (124 points | 174 comments)
30. Show HN: NCompass Technologies – yet another AI Inference API, but hear us out (28 points | 27 comments)
